Text.Value: I've discovered the truth. You're allied with Shadow Druids.

EditorData.logicalname: Player discovers Shadow Druid plans after AOD.

Text.Value: Leave.
Well. A broodmother looks forward, never back. I am First Druid now. And I will keep my children safe.
Halsin is dead. I thought you should know.
Silvanus keep you.
Oh, hells - the prayer can wait. I'm... I'm going to miss him.
Leave.
Attack.
The last prayer will be spoken and the rite will conclude. When the coming army swarms, the brambles will keep us safe.
He's... he's really gone, then. That means...
The tieflings are grateful for your efforts, as well should they be.

EditorData.logicalname: Good Kagha - Halsin's situation was not resolved

Text.Value: Leave.
Finally, we'll be rid of the outlanders' infernal stench.

EditorData.logicalname: Bad Kagha - Halsin's situation was not resolved

Text.Value: We will execute the Rite of Thorns, and you will give no more complaint. In fact...
...you will be gone before the sun next sets on the grove.
I'm afraid Halsin is dead.
The grove is forever in your debt. Walk freely among us for as long as the sun sets and rises.
There is cause for celebration. Master Halsin would approve.
There is cause for celebration. Master Halsin would approve of this.
Treefather, make us tall as the ash and stout as the spruce. I...
He turned his back on the circle to stumble after the past. How fitting that it's consumed him.
Have you now? And you thought you should tell me?
Master Halsin would approve. I pray he still returns, Silvanus willing.
I suppose you want thanks. I'm sure the tieflings have plenty.
We're grateful for your efforts - though none more than the refugees.

EditorData.logicalname: Good Sagha - Halsin Dead in GOB

Text.Value: Peace. Enjoy it while it lasts.
Halsin, gone.

Synopsis: Kagha's dialogue after the goblins' leaders are all dead and the grove enters the victory state.
